channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: France is Busing Homeless Immigrants Out of Paris Before the Olympics
item.description: The government promised housing elsewhere. We followed the buses and found a desperate situation.

item.title: France is Busing Homeless Immigrants Out of Paris Before the Olympics
item.description: The government promised housing elsewhere. We followed the buses and found a desperate situation.

item.title: Copenhagen wants to do tourism differently by rewarding visitors with free coffee, food and museum passes if they cycle in the city and keep it clean
item.description: “It is an experimental and a small step towards creating a new mindset amongst travelers,” said Mikkel Aarø-Hansen, CEO of Wonderful Copenhagen.

item.title: Why Menendez’s Meals With Egyptian Officials Worry Security Experts
item.description: The bribery case against Senator Robert Menendez has revealed how foreign intelligence officials cultivated casual access to one of the most powerful Democrats in Washington.

item.title: Berlin Honors Earliest Settlers, Whose Bones Shared Their Secrets
item.description: Archaeologists unearthed some 4,000 ancient skeletons from the heart of the city. After years of study, they were reinterred in a rare and solemn tribute.

item.title: Gen Z want to live in expensive cities—instead of moving to the outskirts, their parents are paying their rent
item.description: Young people have always wanted a bustling life and career in the city. The only problem? Gen Z can’t actually afford it.

item.title: A.I. Helped to Spot a Copper Mining Bonanza in Zambia
item.description: The site, in Zambia, could make billions for Silicon Valley, provide minerals for the energy transition and help the United States in its rivalry with China.

item.title: Covering of Spire of Rouen Cathedral in France Catches Fire
item.description: The cause of the blaze at the cathedral in Rouen, France, whose facade Claude Monet depicted dozens of times, was unknown.

item.title: The U.K. has ‘far more millionaires than it deserves’ and will watch 500,000 flee to the likes of Italy and Spain by 2028, UBS says
item.description: The U.K. will lose 17% of its millionaires in the coming years, but the country's government shouldn't worry.

item.title: I.R.S. Crackdown on Delinquent Millionaires Yields $1 Billion
item.description: The beefed-up enforcement is part of the agency’s modernization initiative aimed at improving customer service and catching wealthy tax evaders.

item.title: What NATO’s Warning to China Means
item.description: NATO’s rare rebuke of China could lead to actions pressuring the country to curb exports to Russia. Beijing denounced it as “prejudice, smears and provocation.”

item.title: Ask Andy: Can generative AI solve a startup’s problems?
item.description: Bonobos and Pie founder Andy Dunn answers questions about startup problems that technology can't solve, and about grappling with a bipolar disorder.

item.title: Presidential Medical Secrets
item.description: We cover the history of White House health cover-ups.

item.title: A.I. Helped to Spot a Copper Mining Bonanza in Zambia
item.description: The site, in Zambia, could make billions for Silicon Valley, provide minerals for the energy transition and help the United States in its rivalry with China.

item.title: U.K. faces highest level of financial distress in Europe with corporate deleveraging at its peak since 2008
item.description: A slowdown in consumer spending impacted the retail fashion sector significantly with 21% of firms in the industry now in distress.
